page.title: 01KINGSTON ST.MARY,SOMERSET
page.content: Kingston St.Mary is a small village at the foot of the Quantock Hills about three miles from Taunton. The parish church has a fine tower and inside there are some sixteenth century bench-ends. The manor house is early eighteenth century. To the north of the village the hills rise steeply; to the south is the level vale of Taunton Deane. The wooded hills are popular with walkers and cyclists. There is no industry in the village, but there are tomato and vegetable growers to the south. Many of the residents work in Taunton. It is also a popular retirement area. Just over a hundred years ago there were copper mines in the area and some local place-names bear witness to this.
